0. D. K. PICKS EIGHT

INITIATION LAST NIGHT
Men Pledged At Assembly
Yesterday
Omicroh Delta Kappa, national
honorary society, held its semi-annual pledging and initiation yesterday.
Beta Circle, the Hopkins chapter,
elected eight new members, seven
seniors and one junior. Hiss, Strader, Frisch, G. Banks, W.
Wood, and Schiebel were the seniors, and Hall, the junior.
Auembly
The pledging ceremony was held
in the assembly yesterday morning.
Joseph Letopold, ex-editor-in-chief
of the NEWS-LETTER and 0. D. K.
member, was the principal speaker
at the assembly. Several gtaduate
students and faculty members, who
are members 0. D. K., were present
at the assembly.

To-day, you can e big buildings erected noiselessly—by
electric welding.
The structural steel worker is
dropping his clattering hammer for the electric arc. Silently,
swiftly, rigidly, economically,
buildings are being fabricated
by electric welding, which knits
steel with joints as strong, as
the metal itself.

To-day, you can e big buildings erected noiselessly—by
electric welding.
The structural steel worker is
dropping his clattering hammer for the electric arc. Silently,
swiftly, rigidly, economically,
buildings are being fabricated
by electric welding, which knits
steel with joints as strong, as
the metal itself.
